definition: Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: Zhong Kui married off his little sister to Du Ping in return.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗爲了感恩，把妹妹嫁給了杜平。

sentences.english: As a folk-art in ancient China, the image of Zhongkui came into being in the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗作爲古代的民俗藝術，出現在唐代。

sentences.english: Another saying is that his town fellow, Du Ping buried him after his death.
sentences.chinese: 又說，鍾馗死後，他的同鄉好友杜平爲他安葬。

sentences.english: Acting as both the judge and the executor, Zhong Kui punishes vice and rewards virtue.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗既是法官又是執行者，他懲惡揚善。

sentences.english: The Picture of Zhong Kui Marrying off his Sister was very popular at that time.
sentences.chinese: 當年有一幅《鍾馗嫁妹》圖，在民間是十分流行的。

sentences.english: Furious, Zhong Kui killed himself and became the spirit of catching ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗暴跳如雷，當場自殺，死後就成了捉鬼的神靈。
